moan:
呻吟 
to make a long, low sound because of pain, unhappiness, or physical pleasure
unassuming:
谦逊的，低调的 
not having or showing a desire to be noticed, praised, etc.
deposition:
免职 
the act removing someone from a powerful position; the act of deposing someone
elucidate:
阐明 
to make (something that is hard to understand) clear or easy to understand
fidelity:
忠诚，忠实 
the quality of being faithful to your husband, wife, or sexual partner
intermediate:
中间的 
occurring in the middle of a process or series
radical:
激进的 
having extreme political or social views that are not shared by most people

根本性的 
very basic and important
oblivious:
忘记的 
not conscious or aware of someone or something
bribe:
贿赂 
a sum of money or something valuable that you give or offer to somebody to persuade 
them to help you, especially by doing something dishonest

向 某人 行贿；贿赂 
to give somebody money or something valuable in order to persuade them to help you, 
especially by doing something dishonest
supremacy:
至高无上 
the quality or state of having more power, authority, or status than anyone else; the state of 
being supreme
stagnant:
停滞不前的，不发展的，无变化的 
not active, changing, or progressing

水 不流动而污浊的 
(of a body of water or the atmosphere of a confined space) having no current or flow and 
often having an unpleasant smell as a consequence
squint:
眯眼看 
to look at something with your eyes partly closed

斜视的 
looking or tending to look obliquely or askance (as with envy or disdain)
tactful:
有分寸的，圆滑的 
careful not to offend or upset other people; having or showing tact
opt_to_do_sth:
选择做某事 
choose to do
gesticulate:
做手势；用手势表达；用动作示意 
to use gestures, especially dramatic ones, instead of speaking or to emphasize one's words
respiration:
呼吸 
the act or process of breathing
reimburse:
偿还，补偿，报销 
to pay back money to somebody which they have spent or lost 
196
contagious:
接触传染的 
having a sickness that can be passed to someone else by touching

有感染力的 
capable of being easily spread to others
flare:
短暂 烧旺； 摇曳着燃烧； 火光闪耀 
to burn brightly, but usually for only a short time or not steadily

尤指愤怒和暴力突发；加剧 
(especially of anger and violence) to suddenly start or become much stronger

发怒地说；粗暴地说 
to say something in an angry and aggressive way

短暂的旺火； 摇曳的光； 闪耀的火光 
a bright but unsteady light or flame that does not last long
confer:
授予 
to give (something, such as a degree, award, title, right, etc.) to someone or something

商议 
to discuss something important in order to make a decision
intersperse:
散布；散置；点缀 
to put (something) at different places among other things
swarm:
大群蜜蜂等昆虫 
a very large number of insects moving together

大群移动 
to move in a large group
meld:
融合 
to blend or mix together
emphatic:
措词强烈的；断然的；坚决的 
said or done in a forceful or definite way
equivocal:
模棱两可的 
having two or more possible meanings

难以理解的，难以解释清楚的 
not easily understood or explained
cynical:
认为世人皆自私的，愤世嫉俗的，犬儒主义的 
believing that people are generally selfish and dishonest
magnificent:
华丽的 
very beautiful or impressive; very great
pretentious:
自负的；矫饰的；炫耀的 
having or showing the unpleasant quality of people who want to be regarded as more 
impressive, successful, or important than they really are 
197
detritus:
碎屑，碎石 
the pieces that are left when something breaks, falls apart, is destroyed, etc.
constitution:
体格 
the physical health and condition of a person or animal

宪法 
the system of beliefs and laws by which a country, state, or organization is governed
ablaze:
熊熊燃烧的 
in the process of burning; on fire
reap:
收割，收获 
to cut and collect (a plant, crop, etc.) from a field

获得 
to get (something, such as a reward) as a result of something that you have done
indiction:
控告；诏示 
accusation; a 15-year cycle used as a chronological unit in several ancient and medieval systems
taciturn:
不爱说话的，寡言少语的 
tending to be quiet; not speaking frequently
versatile:
人 多才多艺的；有多种技能的；多面手的 
(of a person) able to do many different things

食物、建筑物等多用途的；多功能的 
(of food, a building, etc.) having many different uses
sensational:
轰动性的；引起哗然的 
causing great surprise, excitement or interest

报章等哗众取宠的；耸人听闻的 
(of a newspaper, etc.) trying to get your interest by presenting facts or events as worse or 
more shocking than they really are
deflate:
使泄气 
to make (someone) lose confidence or pride
unleash:
释放，发泄 
to remove a leash from (an animal) so that it can freely run, attack someone, etc.
pretence:
假装；做作；矫饰 
a way of behaving that does not honestly express your real feelings, thoughts, or intentions
prattle:
闲扯；唠叨 
to talk a lot about unimportant things 
198
dehydrate:
脱水 
to remove water or moisture from (something, such as food)
aggravate:
使严重；使恶化 
to make an illness or a bad or unpleasant situation worse

尤指故意地激怒，惹恼 
to annoy somebody, especially deliberately
compartment:
隔间 
an enclosed space or area that is usually part of something larger and is often used to hold a 
specific thing
delectable:
美味的，令人愉快的 
very pleasant to taste or smell
contort:
使扭曲 
to twist into an unusual appearance or shape
interminable:
无尽的 
having or seeming to have no end; continuing for a very long time
transit:
运输 
the act of moving people or things from one place to another
nightmarish:
噩梦般的，可怕的 
of the nature of a nightmare; very frightening or unpleasant
tug:
用力拉，使劲拉 
to pull something with a quick, forceful movement
heterogeneous:
由很多种类组成的 
made up of parts that are different
caricature:
漫画 
a drawing that makes someone look funny or foolish because some part of the person's 
appearance is exaggerated

夸张的描述 
to do a caricature of (someone or something); to draw or describe (someone or something) 
in a funny or exaggerated way
resurrect:
使复兴 
to cause (something that had ended or been forgotten or lost) to exist again, to be used again, etc.

使复活 
to bring (a dead person) back to life 
199
protagonist:
主要人物，领导者 
an important person who is involved in a competition, conflict, or cause

主角 
the main character in a novel, play, movie, etc.
pendant:
下垂物，垂饰 
a piece of jewelry that hangs on a chain or a cord which is worn around your neck
terrain:
地形；地势；地带 
land of a particular kind
flamboyant:
艳丽的 
having a very noticeable quality that attracts a lot of attention
sublimity:
崇高 
the quality of being extremely good, beautiful, or enjoyable
labyrinthine:
迷宫似 的 
(of a network) like a labyrinth; irregular and twisting

错综复杂的 
(of a system) intricate and confusing
renovate:
修复；翻新；重新粉刷 
to repair and paint an old building, a piece of furniture, etc. so that it is in good condition again
veracity:
诚实，真实 
the quality of being truthful or honest
ethical:
伦理的，道德的 
involving questions of right and wrong behavior; relating to ethics
poll:
民意调查 
to carry out/conduct a poll

进行民意调查 
to cast one's vote at a poll
demure:
娴静的，端庄的 
quiet and polite, usually used to describe a woman or girl
dogmatic:
自以为是的；教条的 
characterized by or given to the expression of opinions very strongly or positively as if 
they were facts;dogma
approbation:
赞许，批准 
praise or approval 
200
nuisance:
令人讨厌的人或事物 
a person, thing, or situation that is annoying or that causes trouble or problems
perpetuate:
使永久化；使持久化；使持续 
to make something such as a bad situation, a belief, etc. continue for a long time
bountiful:
大量的；巨大的 
in large quantities; large

慷慨的；大方的 
giving generously
dupe:
上当者 
a person who is easily deceived or tricked

欺骗 
to deceive or trick (someone) into believing or doing something
accolade:
赞扬；表扬；奖励；奖赏；荣誉 
praise or an award for an achievement that people admire
plaintive:
哀伤的，悲哀的 
expressing suffering or sadness; having a sad sound
rustic:
乡村特色的，淳朴的 
of, relating to, or suitable for the country or people who live in the country
complement:
补充，互为补充的东西 补充 
to make something else seem better or more attractive when combining with it
screech:
尖叫声 
a loud and very high cry that usually expresses extreme pain, anger, or fear
trample:
踩伤 
to cause damage or pain by walking or stepping heavily on something or someone

践踏；无视；伤害 
to treat other people's rights, wishes, or feelings as if they are worthless or not important
discern:
辨别 
to see, hear, or notice (something) with difficulty or effort
epidemic:
疾病的流行，传播 
an occurrence in which a disease spreads very quickly and affects a large number of people

流行的，传染性的 
affecting or tending to affect a disproportionately large number of individuals within a 
population, community, or region at the same time 
201
embed:
使嵌入 
to place or set (something) firmly in something else
to_stem_from:
源自 
to start or develop as the result of something
omnipresent:
无所不在的 
present in all places at all times
